{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3541914,"name":"Amit sucher","username":"AmitSucher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amitsucher/{size}/257401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T22:18:57.298Z","cooked":"

Can we cut the leds in the middle? (The cable aswell)
The cable and information are connected on the other side that has a cable aswell

IMG-20250227-WA0000720×1600 85.6 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T22:18:57.298Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":493392,"topic_slug":"cutting-leds-in-the-middle","display_username":"Amit sucher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55442,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amit 6738"},"post_url":"/t/cutting-leds-in-the-middle/493392/1","custom_user_title":"Amit 6738","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3541922,"name":"Cosimo Aho","username":"cosimo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T22:25:30.360Z","cooked":"

Yes, though there are some catches. DO NOT cut through the LED itself, only cut the cable on the Cooper lines in between each LED. Seal the end of the cut strip so the traces are non conductive. If you have a cable on the other side, just re-solder it to ends of the cut strip if you need it.

Cut along the the copper contacts.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T22:28:38.279Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":17.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493392,"topic_slug":"cutting-leds-in-the-middle","display_username":"Drakxii","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23134,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI "},"post_url":"/t/cutting-leds-in-the-middle/493392/3","custom_user_title":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3541926,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T22:30:38.245Z","cooked":"

To expand on the correct answers above, either cut along something like the red line (and use each of the “half pads” on the out and in side).

Or cut along the blue lines and throw away the LED in the middle. This will give you bigger pads to solder to.

Screenshot 2025-02-26 at 5.27.51 PM1256×818 43.9 KB
